ADDENDUM

Subject: 
Security procedure for General Aviation Operations and Chartered Aircraft 
Operations. 
 
Please refer to this Bureau Circular No. 26/2005 dated 18.7.2005 on the subject cited 
above.  
 
The following paragraphs may be added after  para 4.2.1 ( c ) and para 4.2.4(c ) in  
Circular  No. 26/2005 dated 18.7.2005. 
 
4.2.1 (d) and 4.2.4(d) : 
Procedure for screening of passengers and their baggage. 
 
The following pre-embarkation security procedure shall be followed by the aircraft  
operator:- 
 
(i) 
Screening of passengers shall be done by means of: 
 
(a) 
Hand Held Metal Detector and/ or 
(b) 
Pat Down search or, 
(c) 
By combination of both the above means. 
 
Pat down search of person will be carried out whenever screener deems it necessary. 
However, atleast one out of 4 persons will be subjected to pat down search on a continuous 
random basis. 
 
(ii) 
Screening of baggage will be done as below: 
 
(a) 
100% manual hand search; and/  or 
(b) 
X-Ray examination accompanied by manual hand search on continuous random 
basis where the percentage of such search shall not be less than 10% of the total 
bags in a flight. 
 
(R.C. Tayal)
